chapter.title: Getting help
chapter.para: APBS follows an open source software development model and relies heavily on the user community for feedback to enhance the software, identify bugs, etc.

sect1.title: User forums
sect1.para:
There are two mailing lists for the APBS software:
Announcements
This is a very low-traffic list to inform users of new APBS releases and APBS-related software (PDB2PQR, etc.). news (updates, bugs, etc.) on this low-traffic list.
List information: http://cholla.wustl.edu/mailman/listinfo/apbs-announce
List archives: http://cholla.wustl.edu/pipermail/apbs-announce/
User discussion
This higher-traffic list is the primary forum for discussion of APBS functionality, usage, possible enhancements, and bugs.
List information: http://cholla.wustl.edu/mailman/listinfo/apbs-users
List archives: http://cholla.wustl.edu/pipermail/apbs-users/

sect1.title: Bug and other problems
sect1.para: Bugs or potential bugs, problems, etc. should be reported to the APBS-USERS (http://cholla.wustl.edu/mailman/listinfo/apbs-users) mailing list (see User forums).
